<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

static enum MHD_Result
check_write_done (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                  enum MHD_CONNECTION_STATE next_state)
{
  if ( (connection->write_buffer_append_offset !=
        connection->write_buffer_send_offset)
       /* || data_in_tls_buffers == true  */
       )
    return MHD_NO;
  connection->write_buffer_append_offset = 0;
  connection->write_buffer_send_offset = 0;
  connection->state = next_state;
  return MHD_YES;
}

explanation:
I found no controlling expressions that are invariant and thus no fragments requiring investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. The only controlling expression in the function is the if condition:

  (connection->write_buffer_append_offset != connection->write_buffer_send_offset) /* || data_in_tls_buffers == true */

This expression depends on structure members (connection->write_buffer_append_offset and connection->write_buffer_send_offset) and is therefore not a compile-time or invariant expression. The commented-out portion (data_in_tls_buffers == true) is not active code and so cannot cause an invariant controlling expression in the presented source. There are no loops in this function whose controlling expressions would need checking. The remaining statements (resets of offsets, assignment to connection->state, and return statements) are not controlling expressions and therefore are not relevant to Rule 14.3.
